CHESS 1.0.0
  • Reference

ABC SMC with single cell sample trees using tree Branching Times as summary statistics

ABCSMCwithTreeSamplesBT.Rd

Performs ABC SMC simulations to recover a given parameter set for a tumour simulation using its single cell sampling phylogenetic trees.

ABCSMCwithTreeSamplesBT(
  sim.id = 1,
  grid = 50,
  mu.rl = 10,
  s.rl = 2,
  t.rl = 3,
  d.rl = 0,
  a.rl = 1,
  random.state = 123,
  nsamples = 10,
  dimension = "2D",
  output.dir = "data/inferred_params/",
  sampling = "tree",
  params.to.rec = "mu_t_s_d_a",
  sigma = 0.5,
  N = 100,
  rounds = 10,
  ncores = 2,
  params = data.table(name = c("mu", "t", "s", "d", "a"), min = c(1, 1, 1, 0, 0), max =
    c(100, 20, 5, 1, 1), fix = c(F, F, F, F, F)),
  target.tree = NULL,
  target.popsize = NULL
)

Arguments

sim.id

Simulated tumour ID.
grid

Tumour space grid size.
mu.rl

Mutation rate.
s.rl

Selective advantage.
t.rl

Time to a new subclone introduction.
d.rl

Death rate.
a.rl

Aggression (cell pushing probability scaled by its location on the grid).
random.state

Random state.
nsamples

Number of single cells to sample.
dimension

Tumour space grid dimension.
output.dir

Path to a directory where the output files will be exported.
sampling

Sampling scheme.
params.to.rec

String of parameter names (will be set as a directory name where the inferred particle files will be saved per SMC round).
sigma

Permutation kernel scale factor.
N

Number of simulations to run per SMC round.
rounds

Number of SMC rounds.
ncores

Number of cores to run in parallel with.
params

Data.table containing parameter names, uniform prior distribution limits and flags to fix each parameter at given (previously inferred or already known) values or not. For exact format of the table, please see the examples section.
target.tree

Phylogenetic tree (phylo object) to recover the parameters for.
target.popsize

Estimated size (as number of cells) of the tumour to infer the parameters for.

Value

Exports inferred set of parameters by each SMC round (as .csv files) into a given directory.

Contents

Developed by Kate Chkhaidze, Timon Heide.

Site built with pkgdown 1.5.1.
